### EnumerateMetadata() {#a9881b6ffb82b3b5fe903bbb205488446}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void ValueEnumerator::EnumerateMetadata (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42; F, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42; MD)</>}>
Enumerate reachable metadata in (almost) post-order.

Enumerate all the metadata reachable from MD. We want to minimize the cost of reading bitcode records, and so the primary consideration is that operands of uniqued nodes are resolved before the nodes are read. This avoids re-uniquing them on the context and factors away RAUW support.

This algorithm guarantees that subgraphs of uniqued nodes are in post-order. Distinct subgraphs reachable only from a single uniqued node will be in post-order.


:::info
The relative order of a distinct and uniqued node is irrelevant. <em>organizeMetadata()</em> will later partition distinct nodes ahead of uniqued ones. &#123;
:::

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/valueenumerator-h/#l00283">283</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/valueenumerator-h">ValueEnumerator.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/valueenumerator-cpp/#l00631">631</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/valueenumerator-cpp">ValueEnumerator.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### enumerateMetadataImpl() {#a06d64555fb6b13a5637c3894cc6138dd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const MDNode &#42; ValueEnumerator::enumerateMetadataImpl (unsigned F, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> &#42; MD)</>}>
Enumerate a single instance of metadata with the given function tag.

If <code>MD</code> has already been enumerated, check that <code>F</code> matches its function tag. If not, call <em>dropFunctionFromMetadata()</em>.

Otherwise, mark <code>MD</code> as visited. Assign it an <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, or just return it if it&#39;s an <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a></em>.
